Photo by SplitShire

This Week in Genesis we’re celebrating turning one; launching a new feature right here on GenesisWP.guide; oh and we’re still rounding up everything else that’s been going on this week as well, including lots of new themes, an amazing showcase, and a popular new plugin and tutorials.

But, just for once, I hope you’ll forgive me talking about this website first.

One year of GenesisWP.guide!

Launching a new website to share all the #genesiswp things http://t.co/2mgV0dpgAw

— Nick Davis (@iamnickdavis) April 24, 2015

This week we’re (I’m) celebrating one year of GenesisWP.guide. I know most of you expected me to give up after three weeks (and in truth, so did I) but somehow we’re still here – with only a few editions missed along the way – and reaching more and more people every week. (If you’re nostalgic check out the first introductory post and the first This Week in Genesis).

Thank you, thank you, thank you

Of course we wouldn’t have made it to one year though without all of you reading, sharing, commenting on and subscribing to this, so first of all a huge thank you to you, yes, you, reading this.

You are awesome.

But I also have to thank:

  • all the guest editors so far (Tara, Tony, Dhishna, Jason and Sandee);
  • all my interview guests;
  • Calvin Koepke, especially for his encouragement in the early days;
  • Carrie Dils, for having me on her podcast;
  • Brian Gardner for his continued all-round awesomeness and support;
  • my beta testers,
  • my regular retweeters, especially Bradley, Marcy, Andrea and Andy;
  • and, most recently, Tonya Mork, Vaughan Simons, Jackie D’Elia, and too many others to mention, just for their all round support and encouragement.

Every time someone comments or shares or subscribes or writes me an email I’m over the moon.

…and something new (Listings!)

Listings! Introducing something new for #genesiswp on https://t.co/0S8EJsTFsA pic.twitter.com/q782AzQ6Ml

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) April 29, 2016

And today, I’m also really excited to launch a new feature, which I’ve dubbed Listings. In short, it’s like This Week in Genesis but everyday! And the best part is you can post your own Genesis stuff (or other people’s cool stuff) and upvote what you like.

It’s still very beta (there’s a LOT more I want to add) but, if you’re a creator of Genesis stuff (whether it’s a theme, plugin, showcase entry or just an awesome Genesis blog post) I hope this will help you get a lot more eyeballs on whatever you want to share with the Genesis community.

Or, if you just want to keep up with what’s happening every day and don’t have a lot of time, you can quickly check in and see the best stuff as voted for by your peers either for today or for the previous week.

‘That’s awesome, but why?’

Because I’ve never wanted this site to be just about my opinion of what is good – and I love having guest editors has been – but this way everyone can have their say, even if they only have a minute or two.

And yes, what’s popular on the listings will definitely influence what I’m feature here on This Week in Genesis and what I share on Facebook and Twitter, so if you’ve got something to share don’t be shy about posting it. This community is creating awesome stuff and I want to do whatever I can to help you succeed.

If my weekly updates have been helpful (or entertaining?) to you over the last year, I’d love it if you check out the Listings on the homepage of GenesisWP.guide, register (if you feel like upvoting or posting something, it’s quick and painless I promise) and, of course, let me know what you love or hate about it so I can make it better.

Now back to our regularly scheduled programme and there’s a lot of good stuff this week!

Themes

First up, a gorgeous new foodie theme from Ryan Townley over at Minimal Genesis, Artisanal.

Introducing: Artisanal, a new #genesiswp theme for food bloggers: https://t.co/MhgTlbSLAO pic.twitter.com/FHAPZzUuV1

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) April 25, 2016

There’s also a new theme over at StudioPress, Hello! Pro. It’s another third party theme (that Pro Plus membership is looking even better value by the week) and is designed by brandID.

Spotlight Your Personal Brand with the Hello! Pro Theme — https://t.co/7DESTYcf3v #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/oTSbEr9R1Y

— StudioPress (@studiopress) April 27, 2016

Plus, a new theme, James, aimed at consultants from the prolific Rebecca Gill over at Web Savvy Marketing.

Meet James: A Consulting Website Template for #WordPress https://t.co/HjlG1mi93i #genesiswp

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) April 27, 2016

New theme tease of Impact Pro from Jessica Huff, looking good (and digging the video preview!).

As promised, here's a peek at my newest Genesis child theme, Impact Pro! Releasing May 2016. ? #GenesisWP https://t.co/akS5SN8fjo

— Jessica Huff (@thepixelista) April 28, 2016

Anita has a preview of her new theme, ISABELLE.

ISABELLE is almost ready! Channeled my Mom. #Simple #Minimal just like she was. #GenesisWP #fbloggers #bbloggers pic.twitter.com/JvmAcqIe17

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) April 28, 2016

Showcase

I feel like I say this a lot but there really is so much good stuff this week that I can’t possibly feature everything but here’s my favourites.

First up, fantastic site by MarkNet Group for nprdpinc.org

Take a look at the awesome #WordPress site built for the National PR Parade by @marknetgroup #genesiswp #webdesign https://t.co/uF2goo4bQy

— Alex Miranda (@mralexmiranda) April 25, 2016

Then, some more Ryan Townley love with his redesign of minimalgenesis.com

Some new @minimalgenesis stuff, in case you missed it earlier:
New design –> https://t.co/8wVBp4qFS6
New theme –> https://t.co/gOKqZkb2t7

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) April 25, 2016

Katie Rosebraugh with a new site based on Wes Straham’s Aspire Pro theme, theartfulcomposer.com

Launched The Artful Composer's site using the awesome Aspire Pro theme by @WesStraham. Link: https://t.co/Xrs5aLKoUD pic.twitter.com/BgMK6Rqbae

— Katie Rosebraugh (@mskatiegail) April 25, 2016

…The DMA for jmarcoms.com.au

New #GenesisWP site published this morning https://t.co/NG1cLTkCkC #WordPress

— The DMA (@the_dma) April 27, 2016

…Michelle Martello for marcholzman.com

new week. new launch. https://t.co/2BtegpJpDY #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/O3BneZ8GJs

— Michelle Martello (@minimadesigns) April 26, 2016

…Lisa Wood for stephanieryan.com

I am so happy to announce that my new website is live!!! Thanks @lisawood and Sprout New Media for all of your… https://t.co/jTnZHIsxHA

— Stephanie Ryan (@SmallSweetSteps) April 23, 2016

…Vaughan Simons for thirtyplusone.co

New #genesiswp site for start-up offering professional services for music managers: https://t.co/jgbZk98XiO – more to come later in year.

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) April 28, 2016

And, Jennifer Hardwick for brambleworkshop.com (h/t Sandee Jackson).

Podcasts

Huge congratulations to Carrie on her 100th episode of OfficeHours.fm yesterday with special guest Matt Medeiros. If you didn’t catch it live, don’t worry, you can catch the replay now!

Did you miss today’s episode? Never fear – the replay is here! https://t.co/pEjZHyqywu

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) April 29, 2016

…oh and check out her 100 episode e-book too. Not only is it beautifully designed but there’s a few nuggets of wisdom (and some random thoughts from me!) too.

If you’re on the mailing list, check your inbox ‘cause I just sent you the new e-book. 🙂https://t.co/Y3v5nZ0QRa

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) April 28, 2016

Scott over at Imagely (creators of fine Genesis photography themes) spoke to Anna Sawin about switching from Squarespace to WordPress.

.@imagely's @scottwyden chats to @pencilandlens on switching from Squarespace to WP/Genesis https://t.co/qxtV1rHmB8 pic.twitter.com/hDSSSHRWqx

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) April 28, 2016

Best of the rest

First up – proving extremely popular on the homepage 😉 – Frank Schrijvers of WPStudio with a tutorial on how to create a custom author box in Genesis.

How to create a custom author box in Genesis https://t.co/P4lYVRcewq #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) April 22, 2016

There’s a 2.0 release of this interesting looking Genesis Shortcode Generator plugin from Josh Mallard…

Version 2.0 of Genesis Shortcode Generator is out and now includes shortcodes for Genesis Widgets #genesiswp https://t.co/PNv0KBiuHC

— Josh Mallard (@aBearded_Ginger) April 21, 2016

…and Josh is also putting a call out to other Genesis developers.

Calling all Genesis developers, let's work an experiment together! You know you want to… https://t.co/o8W47EQ7b8 #genesiswp

— Josh Mallard (@aBearded_Ginger) April 28, 2016

Jackie D’Elia with a handy template for when things go wrong…

Handy Bootstrap template for when things go wrong and you need an emergency maintenance page. #WordPress https://t.co/nYtuKLV2IF via @jdelia

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) April 26, 2016

Brian Gardner shares his favourite minimal Genesis themes (that must’ve been a hard call to make!)

Here are the best Minimalist Genesis themes — https://t.co/JmldqSTEO1 #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) April 22, 2016

Tonya’s been busy with two new tutorials over at Know The Code, customizing the Read More link in Genesis and asking what the heck is The Loop?

[Hands-on Lab] Let's customize the [Read more…] link in #GenesisWP. Thoroughly explained https://t.co/gowvqcfUTr pic.twitter.com/AYosiH4eVx

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) April 28, 2016

And finally, in Srikat Korner, Sridhar’s got new tutorials on:

  • Entry Meta between Featured Image & Entry Title in Genesis Sandbox Featured Content widget
  • Adding Social Icons and Animated Search to Primary Navigation in Dynamik
  • How to show fixed background sections without text in Cafe Pro

How to show fixed background sections without text in Cafe Pro: https://t.co/0gtfbe84kp pic.twitter.com/QjwkEJ4bjd

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) April 29, 2016

That’s all for this week (and year one!). I’m really excited about the next year of GenesisWP.guide and can’t wait to share it with you all.

Till next time, have a good weekend and stay tuned – not only to the new Listings feature (which will be updating every day) – but also This Week in Genesis (where I’ll have some awesome new guest editors soon).

PS The Know The Code competition winner was Rachel Robbins (Rachel, I’ll be in touch soon!) but if you didn’t win, you can still grab a discount on a whole year of Know The Code Pro Membership by using the discount code GENESISWPGUIDE on checkout.

PPS If you didn’t check out Listings yet, please go visit the homepage now, register and let me know what you think!
